meanings.definition: Unity or agreement of feeling or action, especially among individuals with a common interest.
meanings.sent1: The community showed solidarity by coming together to help those in need.
meanings.sent2: The workers stood in solidarity to demand fair wages.
meanings.sent3: In a show of solidarity, everyone wore matching hats to the event.
meanings.sent4: The bond of solidarity between the team members was unbreakable.
meanings.sent5: The image of people holding hands in solidarity will forever be etched in my mind.

meanings.definition: Support or sympathy; unity or agreement of feeling or action, especially among individuals with a common interest.
meanings.sent1: The charity event received overwhelming solidarity from the local community.
meanings.sent2: Their solidarity in times of trouble strengthened their friendship.
meanings.sent3: The cat and dog showed solidarity by napping together on the couch.
meanings.sent4: The power of solidarity can move mountains in times of need.
meanings.sent5: The painting depicted a scene of animals showing solidarity in the face of danger.
